Justice.origin: [Old French, from Latin justitia , from justus just]

1 a.definition: the quality of being just, impartial, or fair [it is not the province of the court to decide upon the or injustice…of these laws ", 60 U.S. 393 (1857)"]

sub_terms.b: the principle or ideal of just dealingconformity to the principle or ideal of just dealing
